title: Goldman Sachs braced for ever growing legal losses
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Goldman Sachs braced for ever growing legal losses Goldman said in June that it had 'agreed to a settlement in principle' Richard Drew/AP Alexandra Frean US Business Editor Published at 12:01AM, August 4 2015 
Goldman Sachs has raised the top end of its range for possible legal losses to about $5.9 billion, according to a filing made by the bank to the US Securities and Exchange Commission. This compares with its estimate in May of $3.8 billion in legal losses above what it had set aside already. 
The bank said that it was in discussions with the residential mortgage-backed securities working group, set up by the US attorney-general in 2012, to resolve claims related to its sales of mortgage-related products before the financial crisis.
